Definition: A home run is a hit that allows the batter to round all the bases and score a run, typically achieved by hitting the ball out of the playing field
A strikeout occurs when a batter receives three strikes during their at-bat, resulting in an out
Batting average is a statistic that measures a player's hitting performance, calculated by dividing the number of hits by the number of at-bats
A walk occurs when a batter receives four balls during their at-bat, allowing them to advance to first base without hitting the ball
On-base percentage is a statistic that measures how frequently a batter reaches base, calculated by adding hits, walks, and hit by pitches, then dividing by the total number of plate appearances
Fielding percentage is a statistic that measures a player's defensive performance, calculated by dividing the number of successful plays (putouts and assists) by the total number of chances
An RBI, or run batted in, is credited to a batter when their hit leads to a run being scored by a player on base
A double play is a defensive play in which two outs are recorded in one continuous action
Earned Run Average (ERA) is a statistic that measures a pitcher's effectiveness, calculated by averaging the number of earned runs allowed per nine innings pitched
Slugging percentage is a statistic that measures a player's power-hitting ability, calculated by dividing total bases by at-bats
The infield is the area of the baseball diamond that includes the four bases and the pitcher's mound, where most defensive plays occur
Scoring runs is the primary objective in baseball, achieved by players hitting the ball and successfully running around the bases
An inning is a division of a baseball game where each team has a turn to bat and a turn to field
The outfield is the area of the baseball field beyond the infield, primarily responsible for catching fly balls and preventing runs from scoring
The pitcher is the player who throws the baseball towards the catcher to initiate each play, aiming to get batters out
The Official Baseball Rules are the comprehensive guidelines that govern the play, conduct, and procedures of baseball games
Bases are the four markers on a baseball field that players must touch in sequence to score a run
Strategy in baseball involves the planning and decision-making processes to maximize a team's chances of winning during a game
The diamond-shaped field is the layout of a baseball field consisting of four bases arranged in a square format
A home run is a hit that allows the batter to round all the bases and score a run, typically achieved by hitting the ball out of the playing field
